result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis E. Zapata Ramirez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:21 a.m. Defendant Luis E Zapata Ramirez in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Soria is given the Oath of Interpreter and interprets for the Court and Defendant.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
15CT127: Operate without Valid DL 2nd (w/in 3 yrs): 10 days jail and $150 fine + costs.
15CM259 to be DRI
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CT127 No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. 
Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CT127.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 15CM259 is Dismissed and Read In.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson concurs in part with joint recommendation but requests no jail or may serve on electronic monitor. 

BY THE COURT:*****
15CT127: 
10 days jail, with huber for work or any other reason jail will allow and to be served on electronic monitor, if eligible. Report today to set up start date. To be served with in 60 days.
$150 fine + costs - Pay in 60 days or set up payment plan.

ADDRESS INFO for Luis E. Zapata Ramirez
Current: 221 Chester Street, Plainfield, WI 54966   (Effective: 07-16-2015)
Prior: 1600 Briggs Street, Rudolph, WI 54475

Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license. Appear in Court on all Court Dates. Give written notice to Clerk of Courts of any change of address within 24 hours. Defendant shall neither directly nor indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.Not committ any crimes. Keep in contact with current attorney while this matter is pending.

Atty Halverson has received a copy of the complaint.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Atty Halverson waives reading of complaint.
Atty Halverson addresses the Court, discussed the matter in her office without translater but Defendant's girlfriend.

Defendant wishes to have the complaint read to him.

Interpreter Soria will step outside the courtroom and read the complaint to Defendant.

1:39 PM Court will recall this case.

Atty Halverson states the complaint has been read to Defendant.

Atty Halverson enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.

State addresses bond, cash bond with conditions, $200 cash bond.

Atty Halverson requests a signature bond.

Court informs Defendant that change of addresses or phone numbers must be done within 24 hours to the Clerk of Courts office.

Defendant Luis E. Zapata Ramirez in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Soria is also present.

1:30 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

1:30 PM Interpreter Soria is given the Oath of Interpreter.

This is a voluntary warrant appearance.

Parties are prepared to go to initial appearance.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Luis E. Zapata Ramirez not in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Soria is present.

9:37 AM Court calls case.
Defendant still does not appear.

State requests a warrant.

State addresses the Court, Defendant has another file pending.  

BY THE COURT:
State requests warrant with $200 cash alternative
